document_data.name: Abyssal Chicken
document_data.text: I'll never forget the first time I saw an Abyssal chicken... Having captured one despite its swift and cantankerous nature, I managed to soothe it with some salt pork, finding that it tolerated being held and even enjoyed scratches on its meaty body. Yet its docility was short-lived, and within moments it reverted back to its [[demonic]] nature and sought to devour my [[tiefling]] guide.
document_data.source: [[Volo]]{{Cite card/Baldur's Gate: Descent into Avernus Dice & Miscellany||Abyssal chicken}}
document_data.mainbody: Native to the Abyss, abyssal chickens were also found on [[Avernus]]. They were spawned fully-grown in the [[Spawning Trees]]. The trees held fleshy sacks on their branches, and when mature they fell to the ground, breaking open.
document_data.Description: Abyssal chickens were small creatures. They had leather wings but were not capable of sustained flight. Their wings were folded above them, giving them a tear-shaped appearance. They had a large mouth filled with fangs and a long tongue. Abyssal chickens' primary form of locomotion was their two large legs, which ended in feet resembling those of a regular chicken. Each foot had three large claws.
document_data.Combat: Abyssal chickens used their claws and fangs to defend themselves or attack prey. They were fast runners and used their wings to increase their speed.
document_data.Uses: Abyssal chickens were hunted and used as a food item. Their flesh had a taste identical to that of a fatty chicken. They were sometimes used as [[familiar]]s.
document_data.Notable Abyssal Chickens: * [[Earwax]], an abyssal chicken that was secretly kept as the animal companion of the [[barbazu]] [[Krikendolt]].
